Package de.unistuttgart.iste.rss.oo.hamstersimulator.external.model

Class Territory

java.lang.Object
de.unistuttgart.iste.rss.oo.hamstersimulator.external.model.Territory
public class Territory
extends Object
The territory class represents territories for hamsters. Territories are rectangular areas with width and height composed out of territory tiles. Tiles again can contain hamster objects, grain objects, or walls. This class provides methods to load or build a territory and to query its current state.
Author:
Steffen Becker

  • Constructor Details

    • Territory

      public Territory​(HamsterGame game)
      Initialize a new territory and link it to its game object.
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which this territory object is used.

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultHamster

      public Hamster getDefaultHamster()
      Gets the default hamster of this territory. A default hamster always exists on a territory, so this method never returns null.
      Returns:
      The hamster object representing the default hamster of the territory.

    • getGame

      public HamsterGame getGame()
      Gets the hamster game associated to this territory object.
      Returns:
      The hamster game associated to this territory. The default hamster object is never null.

    • isLocationInTerritory

      public boolean isLocationInTerritory​(Location location)
      For a given location, tests whether the location is inside the bound of the territory.
      Parameters:
      location - The location to test for.
      Returns:
      true if the location is inside the territory.

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile​(String territoryFile) throws IOException
      Loads the territory from a file. The territory is initalized according to the loaded territory file and the default hamster is initialized.
      Parameters:
      territoryFile - The territory file path from where to load the territory. The path has to be relative to the class path of this class and is loaded via the classes' class loader.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException occurs if the territory file could not be found or loaded.

    • loadFromInputStream

      public void loadFromInputStream​(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException
      Loads the territory from an input stream. The territory is initalized according to the loaded territory input stream and the default hamster is initialized.
      Parameters:
      inputStream - The input stream from where to load the territory.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException occurs if the territory file could not be found or loaded.

    • getHamsters

      public List<Hamster> getHamsters()
      Get all hamsters currently active in the territory.
      Returns:
      A ordered list of all active hamsters.

    • getTerritorySize

      public Size getTerritorySize()
      Return the size of the current territory. From the size you can retrieve the number of rows and colums.
      Returns:
      A size object representing the size of the territory. Is never null.

    • isBlockedByWall

      public boolean isBlockedByWall​(Location location)
      Returns whether the tile at the given location is a wall.
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the tile to check for a wall.
      Returns:
      True if the tile at the given location is blocked by a wall.

    • getNumberOfGrainsAt

      public int getNumberOfGrainsAt​(Location location)
      Get the number of grains at the given location.
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the tile to check for grain.
      Returns:
      The number of grains currently available at the given location.

    • getTotalGrainCount

      public int getTotalGrainCount()
      Count all grains currently lying freely on any tile in the territory.
      Returns:
      The total grain count of the territory excluding grains in the mouths of hamsters.

    • getTotalHamsterCount

      public int getTotalHamsterCount()
      Get the total number of hamsters on the current territory.
      Returns:
      The total number of hamsters on the current territory.

    • getHamstersAt

      public List<Hamster> getHamstersAt​(Location location)
      Get a list of hamsters at the given location. Might be empty.
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the tile for which all its hamsters are returned.
      Returns:
      A list of hamsters on the respective tile. Might be an empty list, butâ€¦ never null.
